metadata.title: CVE-2024-6614 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The frame iterator could get stuck in a loop when encountering certain wasmframes leading to incorrect stack traces. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 128 and Thunderbird < 128.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-6614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 128.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 128.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 128.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '128.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
